column4: Anyone knows why my apache2 won't follow symlinks although in configuration it is turned on?
i geuss restart it , or pc running it
tried restarting apache itself. Don't see the point in restarting computer.
it cuz be the sever got to hot ? or some thing hardware wise is not right
I can restart it but it wont help.
its just thinking about the basics , which for servers cooling is a big one , but  its a though
Not a server. :D My development machine. :D
A normal PC which has no problems with heating :D
if your like me  i take i  6core 32 gb of ram  and 2tb  and turn it in to a beast , gaming, server , video, making 30 web tabs open, and like 5 more thing  at the same time
:D well, I don't have powerful computers... but this laptop is fairly strong. I use my machines for development only. Thenk software is deployed elsewhere.
well i do either but if i did  have the money , which is bout 890$   i  might
Agree. But still I like playing with a weaker machines because then I get to see how site behaves "under load"

very agree  , i just add that i hope you can put it on a scale  , like google mail  when your pc cant or is to slow put an option   to fix the page to load faster, (please moble cell and netbook friendly )  and it is nice it write a app so it can tell whats going on and it auto optimzed itself,
cuz im sick for pages nOT loading corretly on my netbook
